title: Wandile Mjekevu
text:
Wandile Gabada Mjekevu (born 7 January 1991) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays as a <a href="Wing%20%28rugby%20union%29">center</a> or a <a href="Wing%20%28rugby%20union%29">wing</a> for in the French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> competition.
Career.
Golden Lions.
He started his career with the <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>-based . He represented them at Under-16 level in 2007 and at the 2008 <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament. After playing for the side in 2008 and 2009, he made his first class debut for the in their <a href="2010%20Super%2014%20season">2010 Super 14</a> match against the . In just his second match, he scored a hat-trick in the Lions' 65–72 defeat to New Zealand side the . He eventually made a total of ten appearances during the tournament. He played for the s in the <a href="2010%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship%20Group%20A">2010 Under-21 Provincial Championship Group A</a>, making three appearances. He was named on the bench for the Golden Lions' <a href="2010%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2010 Currie Cup Premier Division</a> match against the , but failed to make an appearance.
The following season, he made four appearances for the in the <a href="2011%20Vodacom%20Cup">2011 Vodacom Cup</a> and eleven appearances for the in the <a href="2011%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship">2011 Under-21 Provincial Championship</a>.
Sharks.
In 2012, Mjekevu returned to his hometown of <a href="Durban">Durban</a> to join the . He made six appearances for them during the <a href="2012%20Vodacom%20Cup">2012 Vodacom Cup</a>, scoring one try in their match against a . He played in 13 matches for the during the <a href="2012%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship">2012 Under-21 Provincial Championship</a>.
However, he failed to break into their <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> squad and the following season, he played in the <a href="2013%20SARU%20Community%20Cup">2013 SARU Community Cup</a> for Durban-based club side College Rovers. He scored a brace of tries in their match against SK Walmers and a hat-trick the following week against <a href="Villagers%20Worcester">Villagers Worcester</a> as College Rovers finished runners-up in the inaugural competition.
Perpignan.
In 2013, Mjekevu signed a deal to join French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> side in 2013. He scored four tries in 15 appearances for them in the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Top%2014%20season">2013–14 Top 14 season</a>, which wasn't enough to prevent his side finishing 13th and being relegated to the <a href="Rugby%20Pro%20D2">Rugby Pro D2</a>. He also scored two tries in three appearances in the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Heineken%20Cup">2013–14 Heineken Cup</a>.
He scored ten tries in 18 appearances in the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Rugby%20Pro%20D2%20season">2014–15 Rugby Pro D2</a> as Perpignan finished in third place on the log, before losing to on number of tries scored in the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Rugby%20Pro%20D2%20season%23Play%E2%80%93offs">promotion play-offs</a>.
Return to Sharks.
After the 2014–2015 European season, Mjekevu returned to the prior to the <a href="2015%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2015 Currie Cup Premier Division</a>, signing a two-year deal with the team.
Kings.
Mjekevu was named in the Sharks squad for the <a href="2016%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2016 Super Rugby season</a>, but failed to make any appearances in the first thirteen rounds of the competition and was loaned out to the <a href="Port%20Elizabeth">Port Elizabeth</a>-based for the remainder of the season.
Representative rugby.
Mjekevu earned a number of call-ups to junior South African sides. He was selected in a South African Under-18 Elite Squad in 2008 and subsequently selected in the final <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">South African Schools</a> squad in the same year. In 2009, he was included in a South African Under-18 High Performance Squad and he was a member of the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa Under-20</a> team that played in the <a href="2010%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2010</a> and <a href="2011%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2011</a> <a href="IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">IRB Junior World Championship</a>s.
